author: wsjcom
title: How the Journal Did the Math
text:
The Wall Street Journal built a database of more than 300,000 filings for private placements, known as Form Ds, that issuers filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission from September 2008 through 2017.
The Journal compiled a list of all the stockbrokers and brokerage firms shown on a Form D as selling private placements, then compared their disciplinary records with the average for the brokerage industry. This comparison was based on records filed with the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, or Finra, and collated...
